question:
What is the maximum number of credits a CAS student can transfer to NYU?
A. 128
B. 64
C. 32
D. 16

Which score is required on AP Biology to satisfy both Physical and Life Science Core requirements?
A. 3
B. 4
C. 5
D. 2

What minimum grade is required for transfer credits to be accepted at CAS?
A. D
B. Pass
C. C
D. B

To satisfy CAS residency, how many credits must be taken in courses prefixed with 'UA'?
A. 32
B. 48
C. 64
D. 80

Which of the following is NOT a requirement for graduation at CAS?
A. Minimum GPA of 2.00
B. Completion of a minor
C. Completion of a major
D. 128 total credits

What is the maximum number of advanced standing credits a first-year CAS student can receive?
A. 64
B. 128
C. 32
D. 16

Who must approve reevaluation of transfer credits after the first semester?
A. CAS Registrar
B. CAS Office of the Dean
C. Student Advisor
D. Department Chair

Which AP exam has a direct equivalency to Calculus I (MATH-UA 121)?
A. Statistics
B. Precalculus
C. Calculus AB
D. Computer Science A

Which committee advises the Dean on tenure and promotion?
A. Committee on Student Discipline
B. Committee on Undergraduate Curriculum
C. Advisory Committee on Promotion and Tenure
D. Committee on Nominations and Elections

How many full-time faculty are elected to the Committee on Student Discipline?
A. 3
B. 6
C. 9
D. 12

Which students are required to attend the LS-to-CAS Transition Orientation?
A. External transfers only
B. First-year students
C. LS students transitioning to CAS
D. Only honors students

Which of the following fulfills the 'Texts and Ideas' Core requirement?
A. Quantitative Reasoning
B. Arts and Cultures across Antiquity
C. Writing as Inquiry
D. Foreign Language

Students on probation during LS-to-CAS transition must:
A. Reapply to CAS
B. Meet with current LS advisor
C. Speak with NYU admissions
D. Delay declaration of major until senior year

Which committee includes both faculty and three undergraduate student representatives?
A. Graduate Curriculum
B. Undergraduate Curriculum
C. Promotions
D. Student Discipline

How are Senators elected to the T-FSC?
A. By CAS Administration
B. By popular vote of all NYU students
C. By tenured/tenure-track faculty vote
D. By appointment of department chairs

What must an internal transfer student do before transitioning to CAS?
A. Register with their department
B. Meet the Dean of CAS
C. Submit internal transfer application via Albert
D. Take NYU placement exams

Which exam is NOT accepted for advanced standing credit?
A. AP
B. IB HL
C. SAT Subject Exams
D. A Levels

The Committee on Grievance may not include which members?
A. Tenured full professors
B. Department chairs
C. Continuing contract faculty
D. Faculty from all divisions

Which placement exam is required before taking Spanish if IB credit is older than 18 months?
A. SAT
B. AP
C. CAS placement exam
D. Departmental interview

How long is the term for most standing committee members?
A. 1 year
B. 2 years
C. 3 years
D. 5 years

What must students do to register as an auditor in CAS?
A. Register online directly
B. Submit signed add/drop form with 'auditor' noted
C. Email their professor
D. Complete a Canvas module

A joint major must be declared by contacting:
A. Only the registrar
B. One of the major departments
C. Both departments' advisors
D. Admissions office

Which exam may NOT be used for credit toward the music major?
A. AP Music Theory
B. IB Music
C. A-Level Music
D. None of the above

How often does the Committee on Policy and Planning meet?
A. Weekly
B. Once a semester
C. Monthly during academic year
D. Only in summer

If a student is taking summer courses before formally joining CAS, who clears registration?
A. CAS advisor
B. LS advisor
C. NYU Registrar
D. Department Chair

Which course prefix indicates a course that counts toward CAS residency?
A. MA
B. GA
C. UA
D. EC

How are Alternate Senators selected in the FAS T-FSC elections?
A. Appointed by Dean
B. Selected by random draw
C. Based on next highest vote counts
D. Rotated each year

What happens if a student doesn’t attend the LS-to-CAS orientation?
A. They lose transfer eligibility
B. They must retake the LS Core
C. They won’t be cleared for registration
D. They must file a grievance

CAS students can earn how many total elective credits through AP/IB/A-Level exams?
A. 16
B. 24
C. 32
D. 40

To whom does the Committee on Student Discipline report?
A. Directly to the University President
B. Only to CAS Deans
C. To the CAS Faculty as needed
D. Always to student government
